device_cost_info: one-time purchase price including a device + software
bio_feedback_spec_char_value: no display on the device, data can be viewed via a mobile application
other_signals_additional_info: If other signals are available, make available column yes and the list of signals goes here as text
software_required_spec_char_value: E4 manager; Empatica Connect web dashboard;
validity_and_reliability_parameters_stud: HF; HR; IBI; ns.SCRs; NS-SCRs-AMP; NS-SCRs-FREQ; RMSSD; S; SCR-AMP; SCRs; SCL; SD1; SD1UP; SD1DOWN; SD2; SDNN ; SDRR
usability_synthesis: E4 was generally considered easy to use with charging and handling the data reported as burdensome in multiple studies. Adherence was found to be high but results are inconsistent when it comes to wearing comfort.
validity_and_reliability_synthesis: Most studies comparing E4 to a reference device (RD) suggest high validity of HR under static and dynamic conditions (one study found opposite results) and often report HRV parameters as valid but only in static conditions, although results seem conclusive only for RMSSD and SDNN. Movement and speech have been shown to result not only in decreased accuracy but also in high amounts of missing data. Missing data was also observed in static conditions and was attributed to issues with E4â€™s automatic IBI detection. It also appears E4 cannot provide convergently valid EDA (possibly due to differences in device location). However, one study reported high correlation of SCL with an RD despite it measuring from fingers, with yet another study reporting validity of amplitude of SCRs for strong sustained stressors.

device_cost_info: three year bundle per a device + software (25% academic discount available)
bio_feedback_spec_char_value: device displays only the time and recording status, data can be viewed via a mobile application
ppg_additional_info: transmission & reflection; green, red and infrared
parameters_available_spec_char_value: HR; HRV; RR; Skin Temp; SpO2; EDA; Activity Counts; Sleep Detection
validity_and_reliability_synthesis: Reliable and valid for use in clinical SpO2 measurement under static conditions, for both male and female subjects as well as for different skin tones.
